content.body:
In technical writing about audio stuff, is _“ducking”_ a term that’s commonly used? https://github.com/mdn/content/pull/41377/files
> _This example activates a commentary track on a video by **ducking** the audio level of the main audio track to 50%, then enabling the commentary track._
content.formatted_body:
In technical writing about audio stuff, is “ducking” a term that’s commonly used? https://github.com/mdn/content/pull/41377/files

This example activates a commentary track on a video by ducking the audio level of the main audio track to 50%, then enabling the commentary track.
